intro: Tibetiodes setchuenensis, commonly known as the Sichuan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of Tibet and Sichuan in China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often hairy as well. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
